entry.title: How to open file with custom application in Mac OSX terminal
entry.content:
Iâ€™ve just discovered an useful command to open a file with custom application in Mac OSX terminal. Normall if we open a file in terminal, we will use open command, but it does have something more interesting which is -a flag ( think a as application ). Now I want to open video file with my MplayerX application instead of Quicktime, I just do this:

sh open -a MpalyerX <video-file-path>

For the sake of my laziness, I create a simple alias for it:

sh mp() { open -a MplayerX $1 } # I'm zsh user mp <video-file-path>
